contextual_rationale:
Here's the infographic breakdown of your script:

 This image represents the first mistake: not knowing import rules. The "X" over a document or rulebook visually communicates a lack of understanding or incorrect information.
This image directly illustrates the two strict rules mentioned: a car with a right-hand drive steering wheel and a timeline showing that cars older than 5 years are not allowed.
This visual represents the Carbarn platform. The phone screen shows cars with "100% legal" tags, while a car with an "X" is shown outside, symbolizing that illegal cars are not even displayed.
This image focuses on the "no time waste" aspect. A clock with an "X" over it, combined with a car moving past it, indicates efficiency and avoiding unnecessary delays.

This visual represents the filtering function. Icons for model, year, mileage, and auction grade are shown as filters, with a magnifying glass or eye icon indicating that these options are clearly visible and selectable.
